meta.name: description
meta.content: Nuview Union School District has 4 schools from transitional kindergarten through 12th grade in Nuevo, CA.

li.a: Nuview Bridge Early College High School

header.aside:
Our Goal is Excellence
All schools are closed from Monday, March 16 through June 19, 2020.

div.p:
Dear Nuview Union School District Community,
This afternoon Dr. Cameron Kaiser, the Public Health Officer for the County of Riverside, issued an order that school buildings in Riverside County will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We will continue to provide our students with learning opportunities at the completion of Spring Break. More details will be provided in the upcoming weeks in regard to grading, graduation and other end of the year activities.
Thank you for your patience and cooperation as we continue to make the transition into distance learning. Our priority continues to be the health and well-being of our students and staff.
Sincerely,
David Pyle, Ed.D.
Superintendent

div.style: position: absolute; overflow: hidden; left: 0px; top: 0px; width: 984px; height: 504px;

div.div: The Nuview Union School District presently operates two K-6 schools, one 7-8 middle school and one charter high school. Nuview District offers comprehensive Language Arts, History/Social Science, Manipulative Mathematics, Hands-On Science, Visual Arts and Music, and Physical Education programs. There are also innovative programs in the District, such as interactive weather observation program connected through the Internet with NASA. In Addition, the District has a strong multimedia technology program, a STEM program, and an Early Childhood Development Program. The District also offers programs in special education, bilingual education, technology, and federal and state categorical programs.

Dear Nuview Union School District Community,
This afternoon Dr. Cameron Kaiser, the Public Health Officer for the County of Riverside, issued an order that school buildings in Riverside County will remain closed for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year. We will continue to provide our students with learning opportunities at the completion of Spring Break. More details will be provided in the upcoming weeks in regard to grading, graduation and other end of the year activities.
Thank you for your patience and cooperation as we continue to make the transition into distance learning. Our priority continues to be the health and well-being of our students and staff.
Sincerely, David Pyle, Ed.D. Superintendent

article.aria-label: Free Meal Distribution During School Closure

h3.a: Free Meal Distribution During School Closure

div.div: Our Nutritional Services Department will continue providing a "Grab and Go" breakfast and lunch option at Nuview Elementary School for all children 18 years of age or younger in the District. Starting Monday, March 30th meals will be distributed only on Monday of each week from 10 a.m. to 12 p.m. with both breakfast and lunch distributed for ALL five days of the week at one time. Children must be present to receive a meal. Please have your car trunk open as you drive through and we gladly place the meals in your trunk.

Dear Nuview Community,
There have been several recent developments regarding the novel coronavirus, (COVID-19) situation in Riverside County. To review all communications updated by Riverside University Health Systems, Public Health please visit, www.rivcoph.org/coronavirus.
An executive order issued from Dr. Kaiser yesterday evening ordered the closure of all Riverside County schools from elementary to college until April 30, 2020.
Please read the attached letter from Superintendent Pyle with additional information.

During the COVID-19 school closure period, the district office will be working on a limited schedule with limited staff. If you need assistance please call (951) 928-0066 between the hours of 9 a.m. and 12 p.m.
Should you require assistance after 12 p.m., please call (951) 377-9185.

Based on the order received from the Public Health Officer of the County of Riverside, our Board of Trustees and Superintendent have taken action to close schools, cancel classes and any student-related activities effective Monday, March 16, 2020. The District will close its schools through Friday, April 17, 2020.
